segments.text: We ’ Ve got a lot of work to do now , but take your time over this project . We don ’ t want to make any mistakes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Ok . I should have it finished by Friday afternoon . Then I can check those account over the weekend . We need to have them finished by Monday , right ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s right . We ’ ll finish them just in time . The Macy project can wait for the time being . We need to spend several days on that project , but it isn ’ t due to be finished until the end of the month , so we have plenty of time to get it done .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Some next week on , we should be in less of a rush .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ m going to give everyone on the team an extra day off . Everyone deserves it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Don ’ t say that yet . A new project could suddenly appear .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That ’ s true . Right . I ’ m going back to the meeting . It ’ s been going on for hours and there ’ s no indication that it ’ ll end soon .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Carol said that she would spend some time checking that everyone is up-to-date with their work .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Good . I have to go right now . I really hope this meeting doesn ’ t last too long .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They usually go on for ages .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ ll stop by if I have time later . Make sure everyone knows that we must stick to the deadlines .
segments.speaker: S1
